channel.title: Tutorial on Sudeep's Blog
channel.description: Recent content in Tutorial on Sudeep's Blog

item.title: Architecture and Modes of Cisco 1841 Router
item.description: Understand the external components of Cisco 1841 Router and learn three different modes User EXEC, Previleged and Global Configuration modes.

item.title: Moving to Github Pages using Jekyll from WordPress.com
item.description: I started my blog “hellocoding.wordpress.com” in 2013. WordPress.com provides the basic functionality of posting the post for free. It does not give the way to embed JavaScript and does not offer much control over your blog.

item.title: Invisible Transparent Button in Unity3D
item.description: Today i was working on a project where i required to add the invisible button. I tried different methods like making button transparent, adding the image in the button. But then i came to know about this solution. I think that this is probably the best solution.

item.title: Convert the list of images to PDF file and add watermark using python
item.description:
Converting list of images to PDF in Ubuntu

Let’s use ImageMagick tool. Normally it is installed in Ubuntu. If you need to install it then run:

sudo apt-get install imagemagick

item.title: Understanding Decorators in Python
item.description:
While learning Python in the beginning, i skipped the portion of the chapters on Decorators. After i worked on Flask and Django, I was introduced with the Decorators.

Let us consider a simple flask app example:

item.title: How to delete the commit history in github
item.description:
Sometimes you may find deleting the commit history of your github project repository useful. You can easily delete the commit history by following the procedure below.

It is always useful to keep the backup of your repository in your computer before removing all the commit history.

item.title: URL Shortener with Django (Part 5) - Working with Templates and finishing up
item.description:
Create folder ’templates’ inside ‘shortenersite’ and then inside ’templates’ create folder ‘shortenersite’.

Inside “shortenersite/templates/shortenersite/” create ‘base.html’ and ‘index.html’. So now paste the following to them.

item.title: URL Shortener with Django (Part 4) - Working with Urls and views
item.description:
Now we will be working with our actual URLs and Views of our site.

Open up your “urlshortener/urls.py” and add the following code to it:

[urlshortener/urls.py]

item.title: URL Shortener with Django (Part 3) - Creating django app and model
item.description:
Now, Let us create a Django app. From your project’s root directory run this command

django-admin startapp shortenersite

item.title: URL Shortener with Django (Part 2) - Creating a new django project
item.description:
Creating a Django project

django-admin startproject urlshortener

Now you will see new directory “urlshortener”. Now our folder structure looks something like:

item.title: URL Shortener with Django (Part 1) - Creating virtual environment and installing Django
item.description: I finally got the time to write a Django tutorial. In this tutorial we are building URL Shortener. If you are confused with what we are building then we are building something similar to (bit.ly) or (goo.gl).

item.title: How to remove /public/ from URL in Laravel
item.description:
By default in Laravel the URL to access your site is http://example.com/public/. It is not good to keep public in URL as it makes URL ugly and longer.

So, let’s talk about the solution to remove /public/ from the URL.
